thread.title: Middlesbrough transfer news: Villa striker Rudy Gestede joins Boro on three-year-deal

author: whaughton
title: Middlesbrough transfer news: Villa striker Rudy Gestede joins Boro on three-year-deal
text:
Middlesbrough transfer news: Villa striker Rudy Gestede joins Boro on three-year-deal 
Boro boss Aitor Karanka bolsters attacking options with his first signing of the January window by Warren Haughton Comments MIDDLESBROUGH have signed Aston Villa striker Rudy Gestede. 
The Benin international moves to the Riverside for around ¬£6million on a contract until the summer of 2020. PA:Press Association 2 Rudy Gestede ihas joined Middlesbrough 
The 28-year-old moved to Villa from Blackburn in July 2015 for ¬£6m and scored five goals for the West Midlands side as they were relegated from the Premier League last season. 
The club have confirmed the capture Gestede on their website stating: ‚ÄúBoro have completed the signing of Rudy Gestede from Aston Villa for an undisclosed fee.‚Äù Middlesbrough 0 Leicester 0: Chances missed by both teams at Riverside Stadium CONFIRMED | #Boro have completed the signing of @RudyGestede from @AVFCOfficial ! üìù‚úç 
‚Äî Middlesbrough FC (@Boro) January 4, 2017 
Boro are in need of more firepower, they are 16th in the Premier League, four points above the relegation zone, more worrying for boss Aitor Karanka is his side are the joint-lowest scorers this season - along with bottom side Hull - with 17 goals in 20 games. 
‚Äî Middlesbrough FC (@Boro) January 4, 2017 Reuters 2 Jordan Rhodes is set to leave Middlesbrough in January 
Gestede made 19 appearances for Villa this season, scoring four goals, and despite Jonathan Kodjia and Jordan Ayew who will both be on African Cup of Nations duty, Villa boss Steve Bruce has allowed the big striker to leave. 
The former Blackburn strikers arrival on Teesside calls into question the futures fringe players Jordan Rhodes and David Nugent who both look surplus to requirements.
